clusters.title: Typhoon Kajiki forces evacuation of over 500,000 in Vietnam
clusters.neutral_headline: Typhoon Kajiki Forces Evacuations in Vietnam

items.title: Typhoon Kajiki forces evacuation of over 500,000 in Vietnam
items.standfirst: Authorities in Vietnam are planning to evacuate more than 586,000 people on the east coast as Typhoon Kajiki intensifies.
items.content: Authorities in Vietnam are planning to evacuate more than 586,000 people on the east coast as Typhoon Kajiki intensifies.

items.title: Vietnam plans mass evacuation as Typhoon Kajiki intensifies
items.standfirst: Vietnam is planning to evacuate more than half a million people and ordered boats to stay ashore, while the southern Chinese city of Sanya closed businesses and public transport on Sunday as both braced for an intensifying Typhoon Kajiki.
items.content: Vietnam is planning to evacuate more than half a million people and ordered boats to stay ashore, while the southern Chinese city of Sanya closed businesses and public transport on Sunday as both braced for an intensifying Typhoon Kajiki.The storm is forecast to "brush past" the southern coast of China's island province of Hainan from Sunday evening before heading for Vietnam, China's National Meteorological Centre said.The storm has gained strength, with winds reaching 166 kph, according to Vietnam's national weather forecast agency.It is likely to strengthen further with wind speeds as high as 180 kph, China's weather forecaster said.READ MORE: Israeli airstrikes hit Yemen's capital targeting Iran-backed rebels, local TV station saysAuthorities in Vietnam plan to evacuate more than 586,000 people from the central provinces of Thanh Hoa, Quang Tri, Hue and Danang, where the typhoon is forecast to make landfall today.READ MORE: One of the world's most active volcanoes in Hawaii shoots lava for the 31st time since December Seven coastal provinces in Vietnam banned boats from leaving shore early on Sunday, Tien Phong newspaper reported.Vietnam Airlines cancelled at least 22 flights to and from central cities on Sunday and Monday. Vietjet Aviation said it was cancelling or delaying flights but did not provide details.China's Sanya, renowned for seafront resorts and sandy beaches, closed tourist attractions, shuttered businesses and suspended public transport.'Worst-case scenarios'China's weather agency forecast heavy rainfall and strong winds in Hainan and nearby Guangdong province and Guangxi region, with areas in Hainan set to receive as much as 320 mm (12.6 inches) of rain from Sunday to Monday.Sanya issued a red typhoon alert on Sunday morning - the highest in China's colour-coded warning system - and raised its emergency response to the most severe level, according to posts on the local government's WeChat account.READ MORE: Beaches in Spanish tourist hotspot shut after rare, venomous sea slugs found City officials convened a meeting on Saturday evening, urging preparations for "worst-case scenarios", the government said.All classes and construction were suspended, and shopping centres, restaurants and supermarkets were closed from Sunday. Vessels have been ordered to stop operating in Sanya's waters.Since July, record rainfall has lashed China's north and south in what meteorologists have described as extreme weather linked to climate change.Natural disasters including flooding and drought caused 52.15 billion yuan (US$7.28 billion) in direct economic losses in China last month, affecting millions of people and leaving 295 dead or missing, data from the Ministry of Emergency Management showed.The Vietnamese government likened the strength of Kajiki to that of Yagi, which battered the country less than a year ago, killing about 300 people and causing US$3.3 billion of property damage.- Reuters

ai_summary: Vietnam is evacuating over 500,000 people.
Typhoon Kajiki is intensifying.
Authorities ordered boats to stay ashore.
The southern Chinese city of Sanya closed businesses.
Public transport was also suspended in Sanya.

items.title: Mushroom lunch survivor forgives Erin Patterson, says she has ‘become the victim of my kindness’
items.standfirst: Ian Wilkinson tells supreme court he is ‘no longer Erin Patterson’s victim’ but is ‘compelled to seek justice’ for three murdered family membersErin Patterson plea hearing LIVE: Patterson in tears as victims bereaved by her deadly mushroom lunch lay bare their griefIan Wilkinson says he forgives Erin Patterson for trying to murder him but cannot offer her forgiveness for killing three other people with poisoned beef wellingtons, a Victorian court has heard.Wilkinson, a pastor whose wife, sister-in-law and brother-in-law were killed by Patterson after being served the lunch in 2023, told the supreme court in Melbourne on Monday that he had not fully recovered from the death cap mushroom poisoning he suffered. Continue reading...

Continue reading...

clusters.title: Bali-bound flight returns after engine problem
clusters.neutral_headline: Bali-Bound Flight Returns Due to Engine Problem

items.title: Bali-bound flight returns after engine problem
items.standfirst: Passengers in Perth heading to Bali ended up back at the airport after an issue with the plane's engine.
items.content: Passengers in Perth heading to Bali ended up back at the airport after an issue with the plane's engine.

items.title: Passengers 'saw flames' as Bali-bound flight returned to airport
items.standfirst: A flight full of Aussies heading to Bali had to return to Perth Airport after having engine issues during take off.
items.content: Passengers on a flight heading to Bali say they saw flames coming from the engine before the plane had to return to Perth Airport.The pilot of AirAsia flight QZ545, which took off from Perth about 6.30pm yesterday, was forced to fly in circles near Rottnest Island, burning fuel so the plane was a safe weight for landing after engine problems.During this time, the lights were completely out in the cabin.READ MORE: Mushroom triple murderer arrives at court to face her victimsSome passengers took videos, which showed the plane being met by fire trucks."At first we thought it was lightning, but we were on the exit row so we had the full advantage," one passenger told 9News."You can see just going bang, and you can see the sort of explosion and the flames."The airport confirmed the plane landed after having engine issues during take-off. The A320 Airbus landed about one hour after take-off. A Perth Airport spokesperson said passengers were rescheduled onto two flights this morning.AirAsia has been contacted for comment.

ai_summary: A flight from Perth to Bali returned to the airport.
The plane experienced an engine issue.
Passengers reported seeing flames.
The flight had to turn back after takeoff.
Passengers were returned to Perth Airport.

items.standfirst: A posthumous memoir by Virginia Giuffre, who alleged she was trafficked for sex to Prince Andrew by Jeffrey Epstein, will be published later this year.
items.content: A posthumous memoir by Virginia Giuffre, who alleged she was trafficked for sex to Prince Andrew by Jeffrey Epstein, will be published later this year.

ai_summary: A memoir by Virginia Giuffre will be published.
Giuffre alleged she was trafficked by Jeffrey Epstein.
The memoir will be published later this year.
Giuffre accused Prince Andrew of sexual abuse.
Giuffre died before the memoir's publication.

clusters.title: Family of mental health nurse killed by a client demands reform
clusters.neutral_headline: Family Demands Reform After Mental Health Nurse's Death

items.title: Family of mental health nurse killed by a client demands reform
items.standfirst: Stephen Douglas died in a seven-minute attack by a patient during a home visit. The situation bore "significant similarities" to another workplace stabbing 12 months earlier.
items.content: Stephen Douglas died in a seven-minute attack by a patient during a home visit. The situation bore "significant similarities" to another workplace stabbing 12 months earlier.

ai_summary: A mental health nurse was killed by a client.
The nurse, Stephen Douglas, died in a seven-minute attack.
The attack occurred during a home visit.
The family is demanding reform.
The situation bore similarities to a previous workplace stabbing.

clusters.title: Israeli retaliatory strikes hit Yemeni presidential palace
clusters.neutral_headline: Israeli Strikes Hit Yemeni Presidential Palace; Retaliation Claimed

items.title: Israeli retaliatory strikes hit Yemeni presidential palace
items.standfirst: Houthi media outlets say two people are dead. Israel says the strikes were retaliation for a missile launch by the Houthis on Friday.
items.content: Houthi media outlets say two people are dead. Israel says the strikes were retaliation for a missile launch by the Houthis on Friday.

ai_summary: Israeli retaliatory strikes hit the Yemeni presidential palace.
Houthi media reported two deaths.
Israel claims the strikes were retaliation.
The retaliation was for a missile launch by the Houthis.
The Houthis launched a missile on Friday.

clusters.title: Five per cent home deposit scheme to begin in October
clusters.neutral_headline: Five Percent Home Deposit Scheme to Begin in October

items.title: Five per cent home deposit scheme to begin in October
items.standfirst: A scheme to allow all first homebuyers to purchase a property with only a 5 per cent deposit will begin in October, three months earlier than Labor promised at the federal election.
items.content: A scheme to allow all first homebuyers to purchase a property with only a 5 per cent deposit will begin in October, three months earlier than Labor promised at the federal election.

ai_summary: A five percent home deposit scheme will begin in October.
The scheme is for first homebuyers.
The scheme allows purchasing a property with a small deposit.
The scheme starts three months earlier than promised.
The Labor party made the promise during the federal election.

clusters.title: Labor puts hurt on Coalition divide, allowing debate on Joyce's net zero bill
clusters.neutral_headline: Labor Allows Debate on Joyce's Net Zero Bill

items.title: Labor puts hurt on Coalition divide, allowing debate on Joyce's net zero bill
items.standfirst: Labor will seek to maximise internal Coalition divisions over whether to scrap its net zero emissions commitment, allowing debate in the chamber today on Barnaby Joyce's bill to repeal climate laws.
items.content: Labor will seek to maximise internal Coalition divisions over whether to scrap its net zero emissions commitment, allowing debate in the chamber today on Barnaby Joyce's bill to repeal climate laws.

ai_summary: Labor will allow debate on Barnaby Joyce's bill.
The bill concerns repealing climate laws.
Labor seeks to exploit Coalition divisions.
The debate will occur in the chamber today.
The bill relates to net zero emissions commitments.

clusters.title: Vance says Russia granting concessions as Ukraine marks independence
clusters.neutral_headline: Ukraine Marks Independence as Russia Grants Concessions

items.title: Vance says Russia granting concessions as Ukraine marks independence
items.standfirst: Demonstrations are held in Ukraine and across Europe as the country marks its 34th year of independence and the fourth year since Russia's invasion began.
items.content: Demonstrations are held in Ukraine and across Europe as the country marks its 34th year of independence and the fourth year since Russia's invasion began.

ai_summary: Ukraine is marking its 34th year of independence.
Demonstrations are held in Ukraine and Europe.
The fourth year of Russia's invasion is marked.
Russia is reportedly granting concessions.
The demonstrations are in support of Ukraine.

clusters.title: 'Toxic' relationship between private insurers and hospitals deteriorates
clusters.neutral_headline: Private Insurers and Hospitals' Relationship Deteriorates

items.title: 'Toxic' relationship between private insurers and hospitals deteriorates
items.standfirst: The peak private hospitals body has written to the prime minister, detailing what it claims are some of the worst behaviours by private health insurers.
items.content: The peak private hospitals body has written to the prime minister, detailing what it claims are some of the worst behaviours by private health insurers.

ai_summary: The relationship between private insurers and hospitals is deteriorating.
The peak private hospitals body wrote to the prime minister.
The letter details alleged poor behavior by insurers.
The letter claims insurers are engaging in bad practices.
The prime minister received the letter.
